parameters.name: identityProviderConfig
parameters.description: An object representing an identity provider configuration. The type of the identity provider configuration. The only type available is oidc. The name of the identity provider configuration.

nested_params.name: type
nested_params.description: The type of the identity provider configuration. The only type available is oidc.

nested_params.name: name
nested_params.description: The name of the identity provider configuration.

nested_items.name: identityProviderConfig
nested_items.description: The object that represents an OpenID Connect (OIDC) identity provider configuration.

nested_items.name: issuerUrl
nested_items.description: The URL of the OIDC identity provider that allows the API server to discover public signing keys for verifying tokens.

nested_items.name: clientId
nested_items.description: This is also known as audience. The ID of the client application that makes authentication requests to the OIDC identity provider.

nested_items.name: usernameClaim
nested_items.description: The JSON Web token (JWT) claim that is used as the username.

nested_items.name: usernamePrefix
nested_items.description: The prefix that is prepended to username claims to prevent clashes with existing names. The prefix can't contain system:

nested_items.name: groupsClaim
nested_items.description: The JSON web token (JWT) claim that the provider uses to return your groups.

nested_items.name: groupsPrefix
nested_items.description: The prefix that is prepended to group claims to prevent clashes with existing names (such as system: groups). For example, the value `` oidc:`` creates group names like oidc:engineering and oidc:infra. The prefix can't contain system:

nested_items.name: requiredClaims
nested_items.description: The key-value pairs that describe required claims in the identity token. If set, each claim is verified to be present in the token with a matching value.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The status of the OIDC identity provider.
